summary: Anne B Misita is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail the committee's staff, their positions, and salaries during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination. The consistent appearance of her name across these reports indicates her involvement as a staff member during a significant period of the committee's operations.
significance: Anne B Misita's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's activities.
